0.Pros: N/a none nada not good bad

1.Pros: Not really any pros, you really earn your money. Its a paycheck.
1.Cons: No one wants to work, have to do the job of 3 people, yours and the two people that didnt show up, the franchisees are so afraid of corporate.

2.Pros: Interacting with crew members can be amazing, I made a lot of friends here, the fast-paced work was fun at times
2.Cons: Sometimes too fast paced, generally poor management, sometimes you have to deal with angry people

3.Pros: Customer service is awesome. I enjoyed the training and staff they really help me feel comfortable with the environment.
3.Cons: There are hardly any downside to this job. My Son as only 3months old when I was working there so I had to put in the hours.

4.Pros: Friendly staff, employee discount, flexible schedule
4.Cons: Rude customers from time to time

5.Pros: Flexible HoursSome Autonomy in Management Position
5.Cons: Low pay, limited training opportunities, bosses do not trust you to complete tasks as well as they can, bosses do not train others because they could lose their bonuses. No upward mobility.

6.Pros: The flexible schedule allowed me to work here while also being in high school. I was able to save money for community college.
6.Cons: There weren't very many cons. I knew what to expect when coming into a fast-food job. Sometimes specific customers would cause a headache.

7.Pros: Flexible hours, great insurance, gain lots of training and experience, free meals
7.Cons: No 401k, Poor pay for work done, micromanaged to death

8.Pros: Amazing Training program, easy to move up in company, flexible hours
8.Cons: Large compensation gap between my position and my superior

9.Pros: very hard work but you get a dicscount on food
